intro: Lonicera marilandica, commonly known as trumpet honeysuckle, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It features opposite, ovate leaves that are typically dark green and have a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces vibrant yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. These flowers are adapted for pollination by hummingbirds and other nectar-feeding birds. It is also valued for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
